variant.text: Return distinct city names from Customers.
List unique cities found in the Customers table.
Show department name and number of employees.
variant.solution: SELECT d.name, COUNT(*) FROM Dept d JOIN Emp e ON d.id = e.dept_id GROUP BY d.name;

variant.text: List all departments that have at least 5 employees.
variant.solution: SELECT d.name FROM Dept d JOIN Emp e ON d.id = e.dept_id GROUP BY d.name HAVING COUNT(*) >= 5;

variant.text: Define a primary key and provide one example.
variant.solution: A primary key uniquely identifies a row, e.g. StudentID in a Students table.

variant.text: What is the difference between a primary key and a foreign key?
variant.solution: A primary key uniquely identifies rows; a foreign key references a primary key in another table.
